p: To reopen cautiously the country which is about to create the most freedom through a modest opening of society. For example, it might be a good idea to start by letting the smallest children go to school so that their parents can return to work. It may also be a matter of deciding where the public sectors that are considered the most important can be opened up as a matter of priority. As children return to school or daycare (i.e., in places with high attendance) and people return to densely populated workplaces, those in charge of these institutions must continue to implement physical distancing measures for schools, which for the smallest children will require an organizational effort, and for businesses.
